author: customer
text: Disappointed. This is my first order with The Real Real. The first dress I bought looked like it was black on top and when I received it,it was an ugly olive green/ brownish color and non refundable. The other dress I ordered, I was very excited about and then after over a week, was told that the inventory got messed up and it wasn't available. I will not be shopping with this company again. Would not recommend.
title: Disappointed

author: Noemi
text: They charge $ 12 for delivery, but then UPS sends the package to USPS, wasting time. Also, it's ok for shopping but terrible for sellers. If it weren't for the authentification, I would use only Mercari. Also, bear in mind that the experts are not always so great.
title: Just OK.

author: Ericka
text: Three of the four shoes I ordered (all size 7.5 and reported TTS or fits bigger) did not fit, as in I couldn’t even get my foot in the shoes!!! I wouldn’t have bought these if they actually fit tighter, thus would have looked for an 8! I love the Real Real, I have had (until now) great experiences, but this was so disappointing, and they were on sale - thus non refundable…. However I feel the description of the sizing is off! Please help! I’ve already written to customer support, but have yet to receive a response.
title: Misleading description of shoe fit/size

author: Anon

title: First experience was ok

author: sheilaveeh
text: I’m not sure for which issue this customer service feedback is for but I have inquired back in December 2021 about the dustbags that should have been included in my purchase of Gucci sneakers and nobody has cared about getting back with me about it. I have sent a follow-up email multiple times but unfortunately I got no response and still don’t have the dustbags and it’s April 2022. I need the bags to store the shoes in when not in use and as well as for when I’m traveling. I understand if it’s lost and could not be located but I would appreciate someone getting back to me at least and tell me so rather than ignoring my emails. This may not be a big deal for TRR, but it is for me. If you can’t stand behind the description of your items at least let your buyers know their inquiries are heard. Being ignored is what makes me unhappy.
title: You could do better

author: customer
text: inaccurate sizing. marketed a belt that only once I paid for, waited to receive, and then physically had it was able to see the true size (“80”), saw using a size guide that this belt side was for sizes “S/M”. The belt was marketed as a size XS, which of course it was not. It was huge! Unfortunately I had to return it, and what was even more annoying was that it said “free returns” although that only applied to returns at a physical store location, which I am not near one or able to reach one. So I had to spend $12 to return an item that did not fit because it was falsely described online.
title: inaccurate sizing
